greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of power of two divisors of n that are less than or equal to n/k.
comment: Equals A115361 * A000012 as infinite lower triangular matrices (cf. A129264).
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
program: (PARI) T(n, k)={sumdiv(n, d, d <= n/k && d==1<<valuation(d, 2))} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 07 2018
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Apr 06 2007
ext: Name changed and terms a(56) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 07 2018
